00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantRma.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Oct 24 10:30:02 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing probe set quantification using median polish
00028  * as does RMA.
00029  */
00030 #ifndef _QUANTRMA_H_
00031 #define _QUANTRMA_H_
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "chipstream/ChipLayout.h"
00035 #include "chipstream/ChipStream.h"
00036 #include "chipstream/IntensityMart.h"
00037 #include "chipstream/PmAdjuster.h"

00041 #include <cmath>

00045 /// Min value that RMA uses fo median polish. Must be positive as log() will be
00046 /// taken.
00047 #define RMA_MIN_VALUE 0.000000000001
00048 /// String describing iterplier summary method
00049 #define QUANTRMASTR "med-polish"
00050 /**
00051  *  Class for doing probe set quantification using median polish
00052  * as does RMA.
00053  */
00054 class QuantRma : public QuantExprMethod {
00055 
00056 public:
00057 
00058   /** 
00059    * What version of the algorithm are we implementing?
00060    * @return version string.
00061    */
00062   std::string getVersion() {
00063     return "1.0";
00064   }
00065 
00066   /**
00067    * Basic constructor.
00068    */
00069   QuantRma(bool fixFeatureEffect=false, bool useInputModel=false, bool fitFeatureResponse=true, bool exponentiate=false, bool attenuate=true, float l=0.005, float h=-1) { 
00070     setupSelfDoc(*this);
00071     m_Type = std::string(QUANTRMASTR);
00072         m_FixFeatureEffect = fixFeatureEffect;
00073     m_UseInputModel=useInputModel;
00074     m_FitFeatureResponse=fitFeatureResponse;
00075     m_Exponentiate = exponentiate;
00076     m_Attenuate = attenuate;
00077     m_L = l;
00078     m_H = h;
00079     setOptValue("FixFeatureEffect", m_FixFeatureEffect);
00080     setOptValue("UseInputModel", m_UseInputModel);
00081     setOptValue("FitFeatureResponse", m_FitFeatureResponse);
00082     setOptValue("expon", m_Exponentiate);
00083     setOptValue("attenuate", m_Attenuate);
00084     setOptValue("l", ToStr(m_L));
00085     setOptValue("h", ToStr(m_H));
00086     m_UsePrecompEffects = false;
00087     m_UseInputModel = false;
00088     m_FitFeatureResponse = true;
00089     m_FeaturePriorEffect = NULL;
00090     m_ChipCount = 0;
00091     m_ProbeCount = 0;
00092   }
00093 
00094   virtual ~QuantRma()
00095   {
00096         if (m_FeaturePriorEffect != NULL) {delete[] m_FeaturePriorEffect; m_FeaturePriorEffect = NULL;}
00097   }

00100   /** 
00101    * @brief Does this quantification method estimate feature effects?
00102    * @return true or false if getFeatureEffects() supplies estimates.
00103    */
00104   inline bool haveFeatureEffects() { return true;}
00105 
00106   /** 
00107    * @brief Does this quantification method supply residuals?
00108    * @return Return true if getResidual() works, false otherwise.
00109    */
00110   inline bool haveResiduals() { return true;}
00111 
00112   /** 
00113    * @brief Get the feature effect of a particular probe.
00114    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00115    * @return feature (probe) effects.
00116    */
00117   inline double getFeatureEffect(unsigned int probeIx) { 
00118     assert(probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00119     return m_ProbeEffects[probeIx];
00120   }
00121  
00122   /**
00123    * @brief Specify precomputed feature effects.
00124    *
00125    * @param featureEffects - an array of feature effects.
00126    */
00127   void setFeaturePriorEffects(double *featureEffects, int iSize){
00128     Verbose::out(3, "QuantRma::setFeaturePriorEffects()");
00129         if (m_FeaturePriorEffect != NULL) {delete[] m_FeaturePriorEffect;}
00130         m_FeaturePriorEffect = new double[iSize];
00131         for (int iIndex = 0; (iIndex < iSize); iIndex++)
00132         {
00133                 m_FeaturePriorEffect[iIndex] = featureEffects[iIndex];
00134         }
00135     setUsePrecompFeatureEffects(true);
00136   }
00137 
00138   /**
00139    * @brief Use this to toggle whether or not QuantRma should be using
00140    * precomputed feature effects (aka feature response, sometimes know incorrectly as 'affinity').
00141    * To mimic what occurs in pliers we do not dynamically fit the model using the precomputed feature
00142    * effects as input.  Essentially we do just "one pass" of the med-polish algorithm using the 
00143    * precomputed feature effects and output the resulting chip effects. When this note was written
00144    * the above procedure is the default behaviour when a precomputed feature effects file is read. 
00145    *
00146    * @param value - true if using precomputed feature effects false otherwise.
00147    */
00148   void setUsePrecompFeatureEffects(bool value) {
00149       m_UsePrecompEffects = value;
00150       if(m_UsePrecompEffects) { 
00151         if(m_FeaturePriorEffect == NULL) {
00152           Err::errAbort("QuantRma::setUsePrecompFeatureEffects() - Can't use precomputed feature effects without supplying them first.");
00153         }
00154         setFitFeatureResponse(false);
00155         setUseInputModel(true);  
00156       }
00157       else {
00158         setFitFeatureResponse(true);
00159         setUseInputModel(false); 
00160       }
00161   }
00162   /** 
00163    * @brief Set the boolean value which determines whether or not we dynaimically fit 
00164    * the model to the feature effect values. 
00165    */
00166   void setFitFeatureResponse(bool value){
00167     m_FitFeatureResponse = value;
00168     setOptValue("FitFeatureResponse", value);
00169   }
00170    
00171   /** 
00172    * @brief Get the boolean value which determines whether or not we dynaimically fit 
00173    * the model to the feature effect values. 
00174    */
00175   bool getFitFeatureResponse(){
00176    return  m_FitFeatureResponse;
00177   }
00178    
00179   /** 
00180    * @brief Set the boolean value which determines whether or not we use precomputed 
00181    * feature effect values. 
00182    */
00183   void setUseInputModel(bool value){
00184     m_UseInputModel=value;
00185     setOptValue("UseInputModel", value);
00186   }
00187    
00188   /** 
00189    * @brief Get the boolean value which determines whether or not we use  precomputed
00190    * feature effect values. 
00191    */
00192   bool getUseInputModel (){
00193    return  m_UseInputModel;
00194   }
00195 
00196 
00197   /** 
00198    * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00199    * primary interest.
00200    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00201    * @return estimated intensity.
00202    */
00203   inline double getTargetEffect(unsigned int chipIx) {
00204     assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount);
00205     if(m_Exponentiate)
00206         return pow((double)2.0,(double)m_ChipEffects[chipIx]);
00207     return m_ChipEffects[chipIx];
00208   }
00209 
00210   /** 
00211    * @brief Get the residual (the intensity not explained by
00212    * model). Supplied as log_2() transformed.
00213    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00214    * @param chipIx - Chip index in experiment.
00215    * @return intensity not explained by model.
00216    */
00217   inline double getResidual(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) {
00218     assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00219     return m_PM[chipIx][probeIx];
00220   }
00221 
00222   /** 
00223    * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00224    * primary interest. Alias for getTargetEffect()
00225    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00226    * @return estimated intensity.
00227    */
00228   inline double getSignalEstimate(unsigned int chipIx) {
00229     return getTargetEffect(chipIx);
00230   }
00231 
00232   /** 
00233    * @brief Clear out all the data.
00234    */
00235   void clear();
00236 
00237   /** 
00238    * @brief Set the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00239    * 
00240    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00241    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00242    * @param data - Data to be set.
00243    */
00244   inline void setPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data) {
00245     assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00246     m_PM[chipIx][probeIx] = (float)data;
00247   }
00248 
00249 /** 
00250    * @brief Get the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00251    * 
00252    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00253    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00254    */
00255   inline double getPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) {
00256     assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00257         return (double) m_PM[chipIx][probeIx];
00258   }
00259 
00260   /** 
00261    * @brief Set the MM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00262    * 
00263    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00264    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00265    * @param data - Data to be set.
00266    */
00267   inline void setMMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data) {
00268     assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00269     m_MM[chipIx][probeIx] = (float)data;
00270   }

00272   /** 
00273    * Set the number of probes and number of chips to be used for estimation.
00274    * @param numProbes - Probe count.
00275    * @param numChips - Microarray count.
00276    */
00277   void setBounds(unsigned int numProbes, unsigned int numChips);
00278 
00279   /** 
00280    * What scale are the target effects on? Are they linear (like
00281    * plier) or log2 (like rma)
00282    * @return - What scale are the results provided in?
00283    */
00284   virtual Scale getScale() { return m_Exponentiate ? Linear : Log2; }
00285 
00286   /** 
00287    * @brief Do the heavy lifting of median polish. If PM-MM is zero
00288    * threshold at a small positive number to avoid taking logs of
00289    * numbers that aren't positive.
00290    */
00291   void computeEstimate();
00292 
00293   /** 
00294    * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00295    * set, chip layout and data.
00296    * 
00297    * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00298    * @param layout - Chip layout annotation.
00299    * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00300    * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data before use.
00301    * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00302    * @return True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00303    */
00304   bool setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00305              std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);

00307   /** 
00308    * @brief Return number of features (probes).
00309    * @return feature count.
00310    */
00311   inline unsigned int getNumFeatures()  { return m_ProbeCount; }

00313   /** 
00314    * @brief Return number of targets (experiments or chips).
00315    * @return target count

00317   inline unsigned int getNumTargets() { return m_ChipCount; }

00319   /** 
00320    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00321    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00322    */
00323   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00324     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00325     SelfDoc::Opt fixFeatureEffect = {"FixFeatureEffect", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00326                           "Force the calculation of target estimate using calculated feature effects."};
00327     opts.push_back(fixFeatureEffect);
00328     SelfDoc::Opt useInputModel = {"UseInputModel", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA", 
00329                                        "Use provided values as the initial model of Feature Responses."};
00330     opts.push_back(useInputModel);     
00331     SelfDoc::Opt fitFeatureResponse = {"FitFeatureResponse", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "true", "true", "NA", "NA",  
00332                                             "Fit Feature Response dynamically or don't update from initial values."};
00333     opts.push_back(fitFeatureResponse);
00334     SelfDoc::Opt expon = {"expon", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00335                           "Convert back from log space by exponentiating the target estimate (i.e. 2^x)."};
00336     opts.push_back(expon);
00337     SelfDoc::Opt attenuate = {"attenuate", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "true", "true", "NA", "NA",
00338                               "Indicate whether or not to attenuate mismatch value when using non-PM-only adjuster."};
00339     opts.push_back(attenuate);
00340     SelfDoc::Opt l = {"l", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.005", "0.005", "0", "1",
00341                       "Tunable parameter for attenuating mismatch value for non-PM-only adjusters."};
00342     opts.push_back(l);
00343     SelfDoc::Opt h = {"h", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "-1", "-1", "-1", "NA",
00344                       "Used fixed constant to attenuate mismatch. Is set to 4*PM*MM*L when default is supplied."};
00345     opts.push_back(h);
00346     
00347     return opts;
00348   }
00349 
00350   /** 
00351    * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00352    * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00353    */
00354   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00355     doc.setDocName(QUANTRMASTR);
00356     doc.setDocDescription("Performs a median polish to estimate target and probe effects. Resulting summaries are in log2 space by default. Used in summary step of RMA as described in Irizarry et al 2003.");
00357     doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00358   }
00359 
00360   /** 
00361    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00362    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00363    * @return SelfDoc
00364    */
00365   static SelfDoc explainSelf() { 
00366     SelfDoc doc;
00367     setupSelfDoc(doc);
00368     return doc;
00369   }
00370 
00371   /** 
00372    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00373    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00374    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00375    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00376    * 
00377    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00378    * 
00379    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00380    */
00381   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
00382     SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00383     bool fixFeatureEffect = false;
00384     bool useInputModel = false;
00385     bool fitFeatureResponse = true;
00386     bool expon = false;
00387     bool attenuate = true;
00388     float l = 0.005f;
00389     float h = -1.0f;
00390     fillInValue(fixFeatureEffect, "FixFeatureEffect", param, doc);
00391     fillInValue(useInputModel, "UseInputModel", param, doc);
00392     fillInValue(fitFeatureResponse, "FitFeatureResponse", param, doc);
00393     fillInValue(expon, "expon", param, doc);
00394     fillInValue(attenuate, "attenuate", param, doc);
00395     fillInValue(l, "l", param, doc);
00396     fillInValue(h, "h", param, doc);
00397     QuantRma *rma = new QuantRma(fixFeatureEffect,useInputModel,fitFeatureResponse,expon,attenuate,l,h);
00398     return rma;
00399   }
00400 
00401   /**
00402    * Custom configuration for this QuantMethod
00403    */
00404   virtual void setParameters(PsBoard &board);
00405 
00406 private:
00407   /// Number of chips in experiment
00408   unsigned int m_ChipCount;
00409   /// Number of probes (features) in probe sets
00410   unsigned int m_ProbeCount;
00411   /// Data matrix for PM probes.
00412   std::vector<std::vector<float> > m_PM;
00413   /// Data matrix for MM estimates.
00414   std::vector<std::vector<float> > m_MM;
00415   /// Effects of columns (probes)
00416   std::vector<float> m_ProbeEffects;
00417   /// Effects of rows (chips)
00418   std::vector<float> m_ChipEffects;
00419   /// Should we force the calculation of the target effects using calculated feature effects?
00420   bool m_FixFeatureEffect;
00421   /// Should we exponentiate the target effects? i.e. 2^X to compensate for taking log_2
00422   bool m_Exponentiate;
00423   /// Should we use an attenuated mismatch, or simply cap the lower bounds when using non-PM-only adjuster
00424   bool m_Attenuate;
00425   /// Tunable parameter for handling background value in non-PM-only adjusters
00426   float m_L;
00427   /// Override use of computed H from data with fixed constant in background attenuation
00428   float m_H;
00429   /// Precomputed feature effects. 
00430   double* m_FeaturePriorEffect;
00431   /// Should we use the precomputed probe/feature effects in m_FeaturePriorEffect?
00432   bool m_UsePrecompEffects;
00433   // Do we dynamically fit the model to the feature effects (either default values or values provided  by user).   
00434   bool m_FitFeatureResponse;
00435   // Do we use values provided by the user    
00436   bool m_UseInputModel;
00437 
00438 };
00439 
00440 #endif /* _QUANTRMA_H_ */
